remarks: Value of the evaluation functor at a morphism.  (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 12-Jan-2017.)
statement:
evlfval.e $e |- E = ( C evalF D ) $.
evlfval.c $e |- ( ph -> C e. Cat ) $.
evlfval.d $e |- ( ph -> D e. Cat ) $.
evlfval.b $e |- B = ( Base ` C ) $.
evlfval.h $e |- H = ( Hom ` C ) $.
evlfval.o $e |- .x. = ( comp ` D ) $.
evlfval.n $e |- N = ( C Nat D ) $.
evlf2.f $e |- ( ph -> F e. ( C Func D ) ) $.
evlf2.g $e |- ( ph -> G e. ( C Func D ) ) $.
evlf2.x $e |- ( ph -> X e. B ) $.
evlf2.y $e |- ( ph -> Y e. B ) $.
evlf2.l $e |- L = ( <. F , X >. ( 2nd ` E ) <. G , Y >. ) $.
evlf2 $p |- ( ph -> L = ( a e. ( F N G ) , g e. ( X H Y ) |-> ( ( a ` Y ) ( <. ( ( 1st ` F ) ` X ) , ( ( 1st ` F ) ` Y ) >. .x. ( ( 1st ` G ) ` Y ) ) ( ( X ( 2nd ` F ) Y ) ` g ) ) ) ) $.
$d .x. a g $.
$d C a g $.
$d D a g $.
$d F a g $.
$d G a g $.
$d H g $.
$d N a g $.
$d X a g $.
$d Y a g $.
$d a g ph $.
